skillsLearned.description: Build a web app’s responsive layout and style appropriate to the user’s device using only HTML, CSS, and JavaScript without the overhead of libraries or frameworks (such as jQuery)
Use JavaScript to set up reliable front-end networking protocols with appropriate error handling
Use accessibility best practices to make web apps accessible to all users, including those with visual, motor, hearing, and cognitive impairments
Create progressive web apps that are available offline and provide a consistent, native-app-like experience
Audit an app's performance to reduce page load times and maintain responsive user experiences
Write unit tests that verify expected behaviors and diagnose common web-app problems
Implement ES2015 syntax to perform common JavaScript tasks
Design efficient and secure web forms with basic HTML in order to improve the user experience
Studied how to interview potential users, find a product-market fit, test prototypes with customers and create product roadmaps
Learned the creative problem-solving process called the Design Sprint. Used by Google Ventures and AJ&Smart to create product concepts and growth strategies
Tackled several famous algorithms (Tower of Hanoi, The Knapsack Problem, Newton Raphson, and many search methods)
Learned the fundamentals of data structures, recursion, testing and debugging
Learned several software development processes (Agile (XP), Spiral, Waterfall & Rational Unified Process)
Built a web application through Linux using Ruby on Rails, GitHub, and The Heroku Cloud Platform
Studied how leadership works in different learning environments and practiced imagining the future of learning
Learned all of the new features of HTML5 as well as making HTML5 apps
Learned the history of educational technology and analyzed how different technologies teach users new information
Learned the difference between PaaS, IaaS and SaaS, as well as when to use them
